intro: Vaccinium penaeoides var. epacridifolium, commonly known as the slender blueberry, is a species of shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are elliptical and have a leathery texture, typical of many Vaccinium species. The fruit is a small, dark blue berry that is edible and contains a high concentration of antioxidants.
